fields.description:
If a user has logged in and browsed the source tab, and later someone edits that user's account and changes something (eg. the email address), this change does not immediately (or ever?) propagate to Fisheye.

This is because Fisheye acts like a lazy cache, pulling Crowd users into its own user store when required, and not noticing changes.
fields.summary: Renaming user or changing email address (editing user details) does not take effect in Fisheye and Crucible

fields.description: This is a similar problem to the quicknav timeouts.

Hi,

We would like to link one svn repository to one JIRA project, so that revision number stays unique among projects instead of behing shared for the whole JIRA Studio instance.

Is this possible? How to set this up ?

Thanks

fields.description: Currently, a separate password is needed to administer FishEye.  In FishEye 1.6, a feature was added to grant administrator access to specific groups or users.  We could use this in Studio to do away with the requirement for a second password, so FishEye admin can be done with the sysadmin account.  This would require writing a simple upgrade task.
fields.summary: Configure FishEye to have administrator users

fields.description:
Mouse over comment icon, then mouse off.  When mouse over area where icon is, it fails to appear.  Icon will not appear until mouse over a different activity stream item, and then returns to original.

This only affects FF3: not IE6 or 7, no opera8 or safari3
fields.summary: Mouse over on Activity Streams comment icon is buggy

fields.description:
As discussed with Dusan, having the original files being patched sitting in the resource directory can be quite confusing. Deleting them will make it hard to figure out how the patches are applied when the original files from the original plugins are updated. Also currently the patch directory is flat, so it may have a problem when two files with the same name but in different packaes are patched.
So we are going to re-organise:
# mirrow the patch directory to the directory of the files being patched
# move the original files to the patch directory and sit side by side with the corresponding patch files
# suffix the original files with '.orig' (the patch files are already suffixed with '.patch')
# configure maven to only apply patch files with the '.patch' suffix.
fields.summary: Re-organise studio-jira-fisheye-plugin's patches file structure
Help with Functional spec for PAC Crowd stuff
Technical Spec for Global Admin
Create new plugin in for FE/CRU ActStr

fields.description: We could do this officially if our WebDAV directory was restricted to admins - AOD-1438
fields.summary: Allow customers to edit Subversion hooks directly
Apply Upgrade Pack - 2009-01 to studio
Studio 1.6-rc1 displays incorrect version

Upgrade to jira-fisheye-plugin 2.5-applinks2-1-SNAPSHOT

fields.description:
Customers want to be able to do things like automatically resolve issues after a timeout period.  The normal way to do this is with a [jelly script|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/jelly.html#inactivate], but this isn't possible in Studio.  I assume we have left Jelly deactivated because a) it's possibly a security risk, and b) historically there has been no way for customers to upload Jelly scripts.

Nowadays we have the /webdav partition where customers can upload Jelly scripts (although access would need to be restricted, per AOD-1438). I also don't think there is much a Jelly script can do that a JIRA administrator can't anyway.  So I think we should enable Jelly once AOD-1438 is done.
fields.summary: Enable Jelly scripting

fields.description: Currently any registered Studio user has access to the WebDAV partition.  If we wish to use WebDAV for things like exporting backups, or uploading Jelly scripts that may contain passwords, WebDAV should be made accessible only to administrators.  This would also ensure that /webdav is not abused as a general file-sharing location (it was not intended for filesharing and is not backed up).
fields.summary: Restrict webdav partition accessibility to a special group

fields.description: When Velocity starts up in Fisheye it is unable to find any Log4j classes, and falls back to its default system.out logger. See [^velocityerror.txt].
fields.summary: Velocity logging error on Fisheye 1.6 startup

 Cause:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Could not set parameter "start":webwork.util.editor.PropertyEditorException: Unable to set value for $filter.previouStart

fields.description:
When you visit https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/PLE there are the following "misconfigurations":

1. The wiki tab points to the PL project.  It should point to PLE.
2. The source tab points to the PL project.  It should point to PLE
3. On the issues tab the source tab's "Recent Changesets" link points to the PL project, it should point to PLE.
fields.summary: Misconfiguration in the PLE project

fields.description:
Please make the following changes to the way Activity Stream shows wiki data:

* First off, never show the whole page.  Only show comments. Emulate the data shown in the Confluence recently updated list.
* Second off, trim entries to fit when long lines attempt to stretch the page - do not allow Streams to be widened due to content of wiki text.
fields.summary: Updates to wiki data handling in Streams

fields.description:
From the JST project page, click on the "Recently Created Issues Report" click. On the next page, there is a link "SELECT FILTER OR PROJECT", which, on clicking, pops up a new windows.
It always displays a login page. Even if you enter user name and password correctly, it still comes back to this page.
fields.summary: "Select filter or project" pop-up always displays the login page when trying to view a "Recently Created Issues Report"

fields.summary: studio-fisheye throws java.lang.InstantiationException: org.apache.log4j.Logger

fields.description:
Confluence is missing navbar when upgrading existing installation.
I think it is caused by the fact that we changed the key of studio-confluence-plugin. We need to create an upgrade task that will change current theme to reflect new name
fields.summary: Confluence navbar missing

fields.description:
- Cleaning up the code
- Documenting uses of ComponentLocator
- Removing unused code
fields.summary: Studio clean up - post migration to plugins2

fields.description:
To demonstrate, create an issue with summary "Criação de ações", and then use the search form in the top-right to search for "Criação". There will be no results found.

If "Criação" is entered as the summary to search for in JIRA's "Find issues", then the issue is found.
fields.summary: Studio search does not find non-ASCII words

fields.summary: ConfluenceIndexer exceptions with Gliffy diagrams
Migrate studio-crowd-integration-confluence-plugin to plugins2

fields.description: If I manually create a Confluence space, by default the 'View Space' permission is granted to 'confluence-users', even though this group does not exist. The newly created space is invisible to everyone except the creator.
fields.summary: New Confluence spaces invisible by default, assigned to nonexistent 'confluence-users' group

fields.description:
There are some functional tests commented out. They depend on Streams 2.0 and one on PLUG-256 

{code}
TestStudioStream	
	View profile stream
TestActivityStream 	
	Activity stream rss title
	Activity stream dashes
TestJiraUpgrade 	
	Activity plugin present
	Activity stream num entries correct 
{code}
Please uncomment and fix them.
fields.summary: Uncomment stream functional tests

fields.description: Remove directory /studio-fireball/src/test/confluence-configs/com once [CONF-14276|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-14276] is fixed and released.
fields.summary: Remove confluence patches for renderer module descriptor

fields.description:
When editing a JIRA issue, the current project is not selected in the drop-down:

!noprojectcontext.png!

and none of the links are project-specific. For instance, clicking 'Wiki' takes you to the Confluence dashboard rather than the project's space.
fields.summary: Project context lost in JIRA edit page
Help with JA-SIG import
Upgrade JIRA Studio to streams 2.0-SNAPSHOT

fields.description:
sal-crowd-plugin depends on studio-crowd-plugin, that means sal depends on studio, which is a Bad Thing.
see also http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CWD-1408 and https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-1371
fields.summary: Backwards dependency from sal to studio
Upgrade streams-remote to latest applinks-refapp-plugin

fields.description:
In previous versions of Crucible there was no way to delete a reviews. So instead of deleting, we were moving them to hidden project called CR-DELETED. That project was created by UpgradeTask 3. 
After upgrading to latest crucible we are now able to properly delete project and it's reviews. We don't need CR-DELETEDPROJECT anymore.

Check also DELETED_USER - I think it should be removed too.
fields.summary: Create upgrade task that removes CR-DELETED project

fields.description: There is number of broken test to fix. Pick one and update this page: [Func tests broken by plugins2 migration]
fields.summary: Fix functional tests broken with migration to plugins2

fields.description: It looks that after upgrading studio plugins to plugins2, upgrade tasks don't run after configuration import anymore.
fields.summary: Upgrade tasks don't run after config import.

fields.description:
There are too many locations for configuration and patches for studio applications. Files are spread inconsistently around 

* studio-fireball/src/test/resources
* studio-fireball/src/test/resources/data
* studio-fireball/src/test/resources/debug
* studio-fireball/src/test/resources/jira
* studio-fireball/src/test/confluence-configs
* studio-fireball/src/test/fireball-configs
* studio-fireball/src/test/jira-configs
* studio-fireball/src/main/fireball/icons

Clean up these files and re-arrange them in meaningful structure.
fields.summary: Clean up location of resources in fireball pom.xml
Upgrade to ROME v1.0RC2 which incorporates fixes for OSGi usage submitted by Atlassian
Migrate Crowd sal plugin and notifier plugin to plugins2

fields.description:
menu_indicator.gif is a confluence resource.
somehow the studio-theme-static-plugin menu.css also refers to this resource that does not exist in crucible (and jira).
fields.summary: 404  when GETting /s/build-359/1/1.6-SNAPSHOT/_/download/images/decoration/menu_indicator.gif on crucible pages.
